# Day 20 - Mastering Framer Motion ```tsx title="components/day-20.tsx" showLineNumbers "use client"; import React, { useState } from "react"; import { MotionConfig, motion } from "framer-motion"; const inputText = "is there an orange warning message saying “a person”"; export default function Day20() { const [isHover, setIsHover] = useState(false); const onMouseEnter = () => setIsHover(true); const onMouseLeave = () => setIsHover(false); return (
{/* Right shadow */}

Info!

There is a new update available to buy it

{/* Second */}

Warning!

Maximum callstack exceeded

{/* Cursor Animation */}
{/* Third */}

Info!

There is a new update available to buy it

{/* Input */}

{inputText.split("").map((value, index) => ( {value} ))}

); } function GrayWrapper({ children, isHover, }: { children: React.ReactNode; isHover: boolean; }) { return ( {children} ); } ``` > **What I learnt**: > - Nowadays I am using `mix blend mode` a lot. > > Inspired by [**Hristiyan Iv**](https://x.com/hristiyan_iv/status/1797732381383901209) >
